headline.main: Leaders Seek To Discern Root Causes Of Violence

lead_paragraph: What is probably the most focused General Assembly session in many years got under way today with a lecture from President Bush on the evil of terror, followed by a procession of world leaders saying, in essence, ''Yes, but.'' The emir of Qatar, Sheik Hamad bin Khalifa al-Thani, speaking also as chairman of the Islamic Conference, was typically effusive in expressing horror at the terror attacks of Sept. 11, which he declared ''unprecedented and almost beyond our imagining.''
abstract: World leaders speaking before United Nations General Assembly second Pres Bush's condemnation of terrorism, but some, like Sheik Hamad bin Khalifa al-Thani, emir of Qatar and chairman of Islamic Conference, insist on distinction between terrorists and freedom fighters; sheik cites Palestinian struggle in Israel; Pres Thabo Mbeki of South Africa says source of conflict is great disparities in wealth around globe; Pres Mohammad Khatami of Iran criticizes American bombing in Afghanistan (M)

keywords.name: persons
keywords.value: HAMAD BIN JASSIM BIN HAMAD AL-THANI
